intro: Pisum sativum var. extraordinarium, commonly known as the extraordinary pea, is a rare variant of the common pea plant. It exhibits unique botanical characteristics, including an unusual flower color and elongated pod structure. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and tendrils for climbing. Its flowers are usually violet or white, and it produces edible pods containing several seeds. This variety is of interest to botanists and gardeners due to its distinctive traits and potential for hybridization.
